result.title: Topological transport and/or signal routing
result.description: - Investigate dissipative mechanisms for signal transport, including dark mode protocols - Study the topological transport of signals and correlations in M3, which underlies non-reciprocal transport in M3, and overcoming bandwidth limitations using OEM networks; identify mechanisms closest to realisation in available experimental platforms

result.title: Synergic effects of EM field/radiation dose to sensitize CSC in vivo
result.description: This deliverable will presents results of in vivo tests combining non-ioninzing and ionizing radiation exposure of tumorand the evaluation of a possible reduction of standard treatment dose if combined with EM pretreatment of CSCs with equivalent efficiency.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan: Report on consortium Data Management Plan finished, detailing what data the consortium will generate, whether and how it will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved. The Project Administrator and the leaders of each WP (PIs) will use the University of Bristol as the base for all data management in MagnaPharm. The University has invested over £2 million in a dedicated Research Data Storage Facility (RDSF), managed by the Advanced Computing Research Centre (ACRC). The data to be stored will encompass all documents (text, MS Word), spreadsheets; scanned laboratory notebooks, diaries; online questionnaires, transcripts or surveys; digital audio or video recordings; contents of an application (input, output, log files for analysis software, simulation, software, schemas); documented methodologies and workflows and records of standard operating procedures and protocols. The University will preserve and provide access to research data, beyond the duration of a research activity. In accordance with recent initiatives on free access to research practices and outcomes, ALL of the data lodged at the University of Bristol will be freely available in a fully Open Access model. This is with the exception of commercially sensitive material, which will be stored as ‘restricted’ and/or ‘controlled’.

result.title: Generation of a qualitative model of how to estimate whether a molecule is likely to have its polymorphic outcome affected by a high magnetic field
result.description: Qualitative model of how to estimate whether a molecule is likely to have its polymorphic outcome affected by a high magnetic field from the thermodynamic plausibility of putative polymorphs and diamagnetic susceptibilities. The rationalisation of the effect of magnetic field on morphology may be feasible.
